intro: Gymnocalycium joossensianum, commonly known as the Joossensian barrel cactus, is a species native to Argentina. It is a low-growing, spiny cactus with a globular shape and thick, ribbed stems. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, which are typically clustered at the top of the plant. Its leaves are modified into spines, and it has a shallow root system adapted to arid environments. Gymnocalycium joossensianum is well-suited for cultivation in dry climates and is often grown as an ornamental plant.
